name: sarif-tools
description: Set of command-line tools and Python library for working with SARIF files

repo.name: sarif-tools
repo.description: A set of Python command line tools for working with SARIF files produced by code analysis tools

readme.summary: Excellent installation and troubleshooting guidance with comprehensive command documentation, though quick start could be more prominent and configuration details are limited.
readme.top_issue: No quick 30-second usage example at the top - users must read through installation before seeing what the tool actually does with their SARIF files

injection_risks.description: The use of os.system or subprocess calls is not present, but the 'os' module is used to interact with the file system. However, there are no obvious injection risks.

The '_ensure_dir' function uses os.makedirs which can potentially lead to a directory traversal vulnerability if the input is not properly sanitized. However, in this context, it seems to be used safely.

security.summary: The code appears to be generally secure with no critical findings, but there are some areas that require attention such as input validation and potential directory traversal vulnerabilities.

common_complaints: Output truncation and formatting issues (locations removed, descriptions truncated, warnings not fully displayed)
Missing or incomplete features (baseline diffing, patch generation, optional dependencies)
Technical bugs affecting core functionality (Unicode handling, fingerprinting logic, string slicing errors)
Maintenance concerns (outdated Python version support, missing code quality automation)
sentiment.summary: sarif-tools shows moderate community engagement with several legitimate technical bugs and feature requests, but maintainers are responsive enough to keep issues open and addressed, though some requests remain unresolved for several months.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being August 2025
12 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release cycle has stalled
maintenance.summary: The project is abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and 12 unresolved issues accumulating.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured and clearly marks breaking changes, but lacks migration guides for users.

governance.summary: The project documents the contribution process but lacks a succession plan, contributor ladder, and indications of multiple maintainers.

project_metrics.description: A set of Python command line tools for working with SARIF files produced by code analysis tools

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance, but lacks a concise quick start example and configuration documentation.
concerns: More open issues than closed ones
Few merged PRs in the past six months
Docs: Lack of a brief, easy-to-follow quick start section to help new users get started with the package.
Community: codeclimate: Absolute line numbers SHOULD NOT be used for fingerprinting
Community: Increase minimum supported Python version
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
highlights: Commits in the last six months
Contributors active in the last six months
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
